com.kontakt.sdk.ble.manager

Class BeaconManager.Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.ble.manager.BeaconManager.Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManagerConfiguration
    Enclosing class:
    BeaconManager

    public static final class BeaconManager.Configuration
extends Object
implements ManagerConfiguration
    Each of the managers has its own configuration which is built and delivered to collaborating Service. The configuration contains listeners and parameters specifying how beacons interaction should be performed.

    The Beacon Manager Configuration. The Configuration delivers parameters which influence behaviour of the ranging/monitoring process.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder
      Configuration builder is responsible for creating immutable configuration which acts as a parameters and callbacks supplier and thus describes desired behaviour.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL_CONFIGURATION

        public static final BeaconManager.Configuration NULL_CONFIGURATION
        The NULL_CONFIGURATION does not enable any functionality. The purpouse of null configuration is to replace the configuration specified earlier in order to free some of the resources which keep references to objects which should be freed after finishing working with BeaconService.

      • id

        public final long id
        Configuration Id.

      • rangingListener

        public final BeaconManager.RangingListener rangingListener
        The Ranging listener (BeaconManager.RangingListener). Should be applied when beacons ranging is desired.

        This parameter should be applied before invoking startMonitoring method.

        If not set, the RangingListener.NULL_RANGING_LISTENER is applied to the configuration which does not inform about anything.

      • monitoringListener

        public final BeaconManager.MonitoringListener monitoringListener
        The Monitoring listener (BeaconManager.MonitoringListener). Should be applied when beacons monitoring is desired.

        This parameter should be applied before invoking startMonitoring method.

        If not set, the RangingListener.NULL_MONITORING_LISTENER is applied to the configuration which does not inform about anything.

      • distanceSort

        public final BeaconDevice.DistanceSort distanceSort
        The Distance sort (BeaconDevice.DistanceSort).

        DistanceSort.ASC or DistanceSort.DESC should be applied when sorting beacons by distance is desired.

      • beaconActivityCheckConfiguration

        public final BeaconActivityCheckConfiguration beaconActivityCheckConfiguration
        The Removal configuration (BeaconActivityCheckConfiguration).

        By default, the removal configuration is disabled and beacons which signal's strength becomes unidentifiable remain in the delivered list.

        Filtering active beacons list by applying removal configuration gives more reliable relation to real beacons surrounding in particular moment.

        This parameter should be applied if desired before invoking startMonitoring/startRanging methods.

        If not set, the RemovalConfiguration with unacceptable values is applied and thus the functionality is disabled.

      • discoverableBeaconProfiles

        public final BeaconManager.Profile[] discoverableBeaconProfiles

      • forceScanConfiguration

        public final ForceScanConfiguration forceScanConfiguration
        Force scan configuration is part of Beacon Manager's configuration. This configuration was created because of the bug no 65863 reported at Android Open Source Project. See ForceScanConfiguration for more information.

      • monitorPeriod

        public final MonitorPeriod monitorPeriod
        Monitor period should be specified when Beacons monitoring is desired.

      • iBeaconFilters

        public final List<IBeaconFilter<IBeaconAdvertisingPacket>> iBeaconFilters
        The Filters list.

      • rssiCalculator

        public final RssiCalculator rssiCalculator

      • scanMode

        public final int scanMode
        The Scan mode can accept one of 3 values of scan mode:
        Please note that the scan mode affects scan performance only for devices running Android L OS version. For lower version this parameters does not change anything.
